body.p: supports the CSS Level 4 subject selector (currently a working draft at W3C ), as described in the topic. also supports the :has relational pseudo-class that has similar functionality and it can match an element by taking its child elements into account. For more information, see .
You can create conditions that take into account the structure of the matching element.
body.example: For example:table:has( tbody > thead) Unknown macro: { border}This will result in a border being drawn for the table elements that contain at least a thead element in the tbody element.
body.note: The current implementation has a known limitation. The general descendant selectors are taken into account as direct child selectors. For example, the following two CSS selectors are considered equivalent::has(b c)and:has(> b > c)
